result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A Cerney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).
  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Terminated Regular - 10/04/2022
Order/Judgment For Court Ordered Financial Obligations (civil judgment)
Balance Inquiry
Order/Judgment For Court Ordered Financial Obligations (civil judgment)
09/09/2022 a $20 payment was made on this case and was adjusted to 17CF54.

11:02 AM Defendant Christopher A Cerney in court. Agent Samantha Schneider appeared by video. Court called 2015CM210 & 2017CF54. Before going on the record the defendant stated he has taken 5 financial classes. Agent Schneider confirms the defendant has taken 5 financial classes. Court makes statement to the defendant, will give the defendant $200 credit off the financial obligations for each class taken. Court will end the probation and convert the balance of the court costs to a civil judgment. Further statement to the defendant, needs to continue making payments or the amount will be sent for collections.

Court adjourned at 11:04 AM
Probation review hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order/Judgment Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (10/04/2022) can do financial literacy classes and court will deduct money
Order/Judgment Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (10/04/2022)
Order/Judgment Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (10/04/2022)
Order/Judgment Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (10/04/2022)

10:19 AM Defendant Christopher A Cerney appeared in court, Agent Samantha Schneider appeared by video. Court goes over the number of extensions in each of the cases the defendant has. Statement by the defendant. Statement by Agent Schneider - defendant is on probation for two cases and has been making payments. Court goes over payments made. Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that he can take some Financial Literacy classes, there are 4 of them. Upon completion of a financial literacy class, court will deduct $200 off of the fines and costs, up to $800 upon successfully completing all 4 classes and payment of $20 every month, probation can be ended with the balance converted to a civil judgment. 

Court adjourned at 10:25 AM
Probation review hearing on September 7, 2021 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases - extends probation for 12 months or until paid in full
Agent Samantha Schneider via video

9:02 a.m.   Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Samantha Schneider present in court via video. Statement by defendant - has paid in full. Statement by Agent Schneider - has paid the restitution in full on both cases but still has the court obligations. Court goes over court obligations due on the cases. Statement by the defendant. Court questions defendant how much he can pay monthly. Court orders defendant to pay a minimum of $20 the end of October or 10 days county jail for each month missed. Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.

Court adjourned at 9:07 a.m.
Probation review hearing on September 14, 2020 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (10/04/2019)

1:15 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Jason Fairweather not present in court.  Statement by the defendant, was disabled, but has now been deemed to be able to work and is looking for a job.  Statement by the Court - is not opposed to waiving the court costs if it can be proved that he is disabled and not able to work, but will not waive the restitution.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a reasonable effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court instructs the defendant to meet with the agent and then to give the court a reasonable explanation why the Court should change his mind.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:23 p.m.
from Agent Mike Pulice dated 09/14/2018 re: payment history
Probation review hearing on September 17, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

2:09 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase, defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2 on 2015CM210; count 3 will be dismissed and read-in and 2015CF62 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 & 2 as charged.  Court orders count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders 2015CF62 be dismissed.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Haase.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1 & 2:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.  

CONDITIONS(EACH):

-Court costs.
-Ct 1-Restitution - $291.33
-NO Contact with the victim.
-Court will allow early termination of probation after one year, completion of all conditions and an affirmative recommendation of the probation agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:16 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

10:41 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jeff Haase present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase - had a resolution on these matters, but have not been able to reach the defendant which is not normal.  Court notes these are the oldest cases.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on October 4, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.  Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 10:43 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Court sets Status Hearing on August 2, 2016 at 11:00 A.M.  and all motions and witness lists to be filed the day before.  Plea & Sentencing on August 2, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

11:06 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase - has received on offer on both cases and need to waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Haase and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Haase and defendant stand mute to the charges.  Court enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 12, 2016 at 3:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:09 a.m.
